Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer erred in law by failing to consider the applicant's aptitude and future potential
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant lacked required skills/experience; limited initiative; failure to upgrade qualifications; bonus units did not affect final score
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate error in decision
Legal_Rule: Visa officer must assess skills, experience, and aptitudes; discretion allowed under Section 11(3) if units don't reflect establishment chances
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness, depending on legal issue
Procedural_Issue: Alleged failure to consider relevant factors in assessment
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged legal error in assessment of aptitude and potential
Outcome_on_Merits: No error found in visa officer's decision
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Assessment found to be procedurally fair
Key_Evidence_Considered: Skills, experience, aptitude, initiative, qualification upgrades, unit score (45/55)
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged dismissal of permanent residence application
Defendant_Response: Visa officer properly applied regulations and considered all relevant factors
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Insufficient units (45/55), lack of skills/experience, low aptitude
Applicable_Process: Permanent residence application under assisted relative category
Jurisdiction: Immigration and Refugee Board / Federal Court
